entry.title: George C. Brownell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while George C. Brownell played no part in the Oregon land fraud scandal, a published cartoon (pictured) showed him as the "Pretty Moth" that flew too close to the land fraud limelight?

entry.title: Oxford ivy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Oxford ivy grows towards the light to bloom and then towards the darkness when going to seed?

entry.title: the first person (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that it took 34 years for the first person to beat the game Tetris?

entry.title: Luisa Lallana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the murder of Luisa Lallana sparked a general strike in Rosario, Argentina?

entry.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the stylized animation of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem was inspired by rough sketches in school notebooks?

entry.title: Thomas Fritzsch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Fritzsch, a viol player who rediscovered compositions by Carl Friedrich Abel, established a festival dedicated to him in Köthen?

entry.title: Going Infinite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michael Lewis, author of Going Infinite, compared a rival author to the subject of both their books, convicted fraudster Sam Bankman-Fried?

entry.title: Gracie Mansion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gracie Mansion became New York City's mayoral residence after serving as a public toilet and a museum?
